data.title: Piano Bar
data.text: Gourmet meal. Braised beef ribs. Nice afternoon listening to piano and drinking martinis..Not the cheapest place to go but a special place with lovely ambiance. I return each trip.

data.title: Pre-Show Dinner at Roxy Top of the Line
data.text: We took advantage of getting show tickets with a 50% entree discount. I had the rack of lamb that was prepared perfectly and tender (possibly the best I've ever had). My wife and our guests were equally positively impressed with their selections. Our waiter was very attentive and the restaurant manager came by several times to check on our satisfaction...impressive. As with other hotel/casino fine dining restaurants, the food and service were outstanding, but this is not for the budget minded...save Roxy for special occasions or take advantage of show/dinner discounts like we did.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: We had an excellent dinner.  They have an earlybird dinner with excellent value.  The service was very good and the restaurant is quiet, away from the hustle and bustle of the gaming rooms.

data.title: Wonderful dinner after the show
data.text: Enjoyed the lobster tail specials.  Great wine list and our service was exceptional.  For fine dining this is an excellent choice

data.title: disappointing
data.text: The rooms interior is nice and the  menu acceptable ( remembering this is Reno which has very limited fine dinning options). The biggest issues ,are ones that you encounter rather routinely in Reno, the lack of a professional staff and an ambience that really detracts from the dining experience. However, for a highly touted " fine dining " room the staff was particularly poor and was more what you would expect at mid/low end-chain , such as an Olive Garden. And , as is again now unfortunately "normal", being afraid to miss a buck , there is no dress code of any kind. We had the " pleasure " of dining next to two men with dirty ball caps ( worn through out the meal) , t- shirts and shorts that had not see a washing machine in months. As anyone who has read any of my other reviews will know, " dinning ",for me has three elements: service, ambience and food( including presentation). This restaurant falls very short on the first two and is just minimally acceptable on the third. If you don't care about the dinning experience then go-- however if it does matter to you( and I know we are the minority) then I recommend "Sterling " at the Silver legacy as a downtown alternative.

data.title: Perfect evening
data.text: We didn't want a huge meal just something nice and this was perfect.  After checking a number of restaurants in the general area and thinking the prices were over the top, we were pleasantly surprised to find Roxy. Very nice surroundings with a piano playing somewhere in the vicinity and great service. Our lobster in garlic sauce was great as was the perfect soufflé - a real treat to find!  Our waiter, ALbert was professional and personable.  Altogether a great night and fully recommended!

data.title: Roxy, rocks!
data.text:
One of the best restaurant in a little Reno,
The food and service was excellent and you surely won't be disappointed!

The atmosphere is very cozy and personal.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: I would recommend heading to the Roxy Bar upstairs for delicious drinks and service.  Dinner here was good.  Had the $44 Sirloin and the $16 Burger with salads.  Caesar salad was on point.  No complaints.  Decent meal in a nice, quiet, romantic setting.

data.title: Outstanding Rib Eye
data.text: Wonderful restaurant. Wait staff was timely and efficient. My wife and I shared a large rib eye. As steak eaters I have to say it was one of the best I have ever eaten. Sides- baked potato and mushrooms very good. Chocolate cake dessert  was wonderful. Wine by the glass selection very nice and overall price comparable to fine steak restaurants.

data.title: I would almost give Roxy five "dots"
data.text: I wanted prime rib so for some reason we went to Roxy instead of the Prime Rib Grill (which would seem to be the obvious choice).  The food was great.  The service was generally very good but a little slow at first (like maybe they were changing shifts?).  My prime rib was very nice and my wife enjoyed her steak.   The atmosphere is a little weird (but not bad, just weird) because it is dimly lit and built to look like you're outside of a French bistro or something.   Also, our seats overlooked the back of the sushi bar so we had entertainment.   Next time we might try the Prime Rib Grill just to see if it lives up to its name, but we were definitely pleased with the food at Roxy.

data.title: Best Steak I've Ever Had!
data.text: Visited Roxy for our first anniversary dinner. All the staff from the hostess to our server were incredibly kind and professional. I had the smaller rib eye and my husband had the small filet. We shared a Cesar salad and a side of potatoes au gratin along with a very reasonably priced bottle of Cabernet. Neither could finish our food - but we sure tried - because it was that delicious. Steaks were juicy, full of flavor and just the right amount of char. I wish we'd left room to sample one of their amazing desserts. I highly recommend this restaurant and will definitely visit again next time we're in Reno!

data.title: Reno Fun Train Experience!
data.text: My friend and I came in February on the Reno Fun Train and Roxy's was our dinner of choice with a show. It was EXCELLENT. Service was great as well. The area is calm and relaxing . Prices are what you would pay for excellent food and atmosphere!

data.title: Dinners are wonderful.
data.text: Great martinis.  Great food.  Order the soufflé ahead. Fun to start out in the bar listening to a piano player.  Then move on to the table and a great meal.

data.title: Anniversary Dinner
data.text:
My husband and I celebrated our 26 year anniversary with family on September 16, 2016 at Roxy's.  It is our favorite restaurant in Reno for any kind of celebration and they came through again for us.
My niece, her husband, son & our granddaughter joined us for the celebration.  The appetizers were amazing as was the dinner, wine & dessert.  We enjoyed ourselves & will visit again.

data.title: ROXY BAR & LOUNGE
data.text: Checked out several bars in the hotels and hit homerun with Roxy Bar and Lounge.  Stopped in for happy hour. The drinks are great! Fresh fruits used in the mixers and the lemon drop martini; never had one better.  Our table was cozy with comfortable leather chairs and the bar so inviting we decided to have dinner there. (Something has changed because Roxy is an intimate bar in the Eldorado not a restaurant.) Food served in the bar is from La. Strada (Italian) and delicious; had the antipasto appetizer and veal piccata.   But, making the evening perfect was the bartender, MICHAEL. He is a great bartender and very informative.  Knows his stuff!

data.title: Good but very pricey
data.text: The bone in rib steak at 24 oz and $44.00 was delicious, but that price they could include more than 3 onion rings.   The ala carte glazed mushrooms were very nice.  the Bacon cheese bread was good and the service was attentive and prompt.   A very dark restaurant so bring a flashlight or cell phone to read the menu and or bill.

data.title: Excellent pre-show dining
data.text: We had a lovely dinner before seeing a show at the El Dorado.  My wife an I both had Caesar salads followed by filet mignons that were cooked to perfection. These were accompanied by green beans and the potatoe/artichoke au gratin.  We passed on the dessert as we are not dessert eaters.  Our waiter was excellent. He as attentive but not intrusive.  The atmosphere is romantic and very nice.  You would not know you were in a Casino.  We will definitely return.

data.title: Filet that melts in your mouth
data.text: We ate at this restaurant for the first time.  I have to say the food is excellent and exceptional service.  We all had the filets and were cooked the way we like (rare) with a bearnise sauce and veggies.  We had the early bird dinners which had quite a few choices for the main course and then a choice of soup or salad and a dessert.  When you go to the Eldorado hotel/casino, you have to try this restaurant.  They also have some private rooms for small parties.

data.title: Drinks and appitizers
data.text: The service here was exceptional. The waitress explained the menu and what drinks would be good after asking what our taste were.

data.title: Great Steak House
data.text:
Roxy's is located in the El Dorado Hotel and Casino in Reno NV. The food is always great. The service fantastic. The Bar is great with over 100 kinds of Martini's.
It doesn't matter if you have a Steak, Seafood or the Burger--I have never had a bad meal.
